parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
